verses.verse: Thus the Lord <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Moses <S%H4872><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Sinai, <S%H5514><s%> in the first <S%H7223><s%> month <S%H2320><s%> of the second <S%H8145><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> after they had come <S%H3318><s%> out of the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>
"Now, let the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> observe <S%H6213><s%> the Passover <S%H6453><s%> at its appointed <S%H4150><s%> time. <S%H4150><s%>

"On the fourteenth <S%H702><s%> <S%H6240><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> of this <S%H2088><s%> month, <S%H2320><s%> at twilight, <S%H6153><s%> you shall observe <S%H6213><s%> it at its appointed <S%H4150><s%> time; <S%H4150><s%> you shall observe <S%H6213><s%> it according to all <S%H3605><s%> its statutes <S%H2708><s%> and according to all <S%H3605><s%> its ordinances. <S%H4941><s%>"
So Moses <S%H4872><s%> told <S%H1696><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> to observe <S%H6213><s%> the Passover. <S%H6453><s%>

And they observed <S%H6213><s%> the Passover <S%H6453><s%> in the first <S%H7223><s%> [month, <S%H2320><s%>] on the fourteenth <S%H702><s%> <S%H6240><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> of the month, at twilight, <S%H6153><s%> in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> of Sinai; <S%H5514><s%> according to all <S%H3605><s%> that the Lord <S%H3068><s%> had commanded <S%H6680><s%> Moses, <S%H4872><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> did. <S%H6213><s%>

But there were [some] men <S%H376><s%> who <S%H834><s%> were unclean <S%H2931><s%> because of [the] dead <S%H5315><s%> person, <S%H5315><s%> so that they could <S%H3201><s%> not observe <S%H6213><s%> Passover <S%H6453><s%> on that day; <S%H3117><s%> so they came <S%H7126><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Moses <S%H4872><s%> and Aaron <S%H175><s%> on that day. <S%H3117><s%>

And those <S%H1992><s%> men <S%H376><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to him, "[Though] we are unclean <S%H2931><s%> because of [the] dead <S%H5315><s%> person, <S%H5315><s%> why <S%H4100><s%> are we restrained <S%H1639><s%> from presenting <S%H7126><s%> the offering <S%H7133><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> at its appointed <S%H4150><s%> time <S%H4150><s%> among <S%H8432><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%>?"
Moses <S%H4872><s%> therefore said <S%H559><s%> to them, "Wait, <S%H5975><s%> and I will listen <S%H8085><s%> to what <S%H4100><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%> will command <S%H6680><s%> concerning you."
Then the Lord <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Moses, <S%H4872><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%>

"Speak <S%H1696><s%> to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> 'If <S%H3588><s%> any <S%H376><s%> one <S%H376><s%> of you or <S%H176><s%> of your generations <S%H1755><s%> becomes <S%H1961><s%> unclean <S%H2931><s%> because of a [dead] person, <S%H5315><s%> or <S%H176><s%> is on a distant <S%H7350><s%> journey, <S%H1870><s%> he may, however, observe <S%H6213><s%> the Passover <S%H6453><s%> to the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>

'In the second <S%H8145><s%> month <S%H2320><s%> on the fourteenth <S%H702><s%> <S%H6240><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> at twilight, <S%H6153><s%> they shall observe <S%H6213><s%> it; they shall eat <S%H398><s%> it with unleavened <S%H4682><s%> bread <S%H4682><s%> and bitter <S%H4844><s%> herbs. <S%H4844><s%>

'They shall leave <S%H7604><s%> none <S%H3808><s%> of it until <S%H5704><s%> morning, <S%H1242><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> break <S%H7665><s%> a bone <S%H6106><s%> of it; according to all <S%H3605><s%> the statute <S%H2708><s%> of the Passover <S%H6453><s%> they shall observe <S%H6213><s%> it.

'But the man <S%H376><s%> who <S%H834><s%> is clean <S%H2889><s%> and is not on a journey, <S%H1870><s%> and yet neglects <S%H2308><s%> to observe <S%H6213><s%> the Passover, <S%H6453><s%> that person <S%H5315><s%> shall then be cut <S%H3772><s%> off <S%H3772><s%> from his people, <S%H9415><s%> for he did not present <S%H7126><s%> the offering <S%H7133><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> at its appointed <S%H4150><s%> time. <S%H4150><s%> That man <S%H376><s%> shall bear <S%H5375><s%> his sin. <S%H2399><s%>

'And if <S%H3588><s%> an alien <S%H1616><s%> sojourns <S%H1481><s%> among <S%H854><s%> you and observes <S%H6213><s%> the Passover <S%H6453><s%> to the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> according to the statute <S%H2708><s%> of the Passover <S%H6453><s%> and according to its ordinance, <S%H4941><s%> so <S%H3651><s%> he shall do; <S%H6213><s%> you shall have <S%H1961><s%> one <S%H259><s%> statute, <S%H2708><s%> both for the alien <S%H1616><s%> and for the native <S%H249><s%> of the land. <S%H776><s%>' "

Now on the day <S%H3117><s%> that the tabernacle <S%H4908><s%> was erected <S%H6965><s%> the cloud <S%H6051><s%> covered <S%H3680><s%> the tabernacle, <S%H4908><s%> the tent <S%H168><s%> of the testimony, <S%H5715><s%> and in the evening <S%H6153><s%> it was like the appearance <S%H4758><s%> of fire <S%H784><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> the tabernacle, <S%H4908><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> morning. <S%H1242><s%>
So <S%H3651><s%> it was continuously; <S%H8548><s%> the cloud <S%H6051><s%> would cover <S%H3680><s%> it [by day,] and the appearance <S%H4758><s%> of fire <S%H784><s%> by night. <S%H3915><s%>

And whenever <S%H6310><s%> the cloud <S%H6051><s%> was lifted <S%H5927><s%> from over <S%H5921><s%> the tent, <S%H168><s%> afterward <S%H310><s%> <S%H3651><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> would then set <S%H5265><s%> out; and in the place <S%H4725><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> the cloud <S%H6051><s%> settled <S%H7931><s%> down, <S%H7931><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> would camp. <S%H2583><s%>

At the command <S%H6310><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> would set <S%H5265><s%> out, and at the command <S%H6310><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> they would camp; <S%H2583><s%> as long <S%H3605><s%> <S%H3117><s%> as the cloud <S%H6051><s%> settled <S%H7931><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> the tabernacle, <S%H4908><s%> they remained <S%H2583><s%> camped. <S%H2583><s%>

Even when the cloud <S%H6051><s%> lingered <S%H748><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> the tabernacle <S%H4908><s%> for many <S%H7227><s%> days, <S%H3117><s%> the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> would keep <S%H8104><s%> the Lord's charge <S%H4931><s%> and not set <S%H5265><s%> out.

If sometimes <S%H3426><s%> the cloud <S%H6051><s%> remained <S%H1961><s%> a few <S%H4557><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> the tabernacle, <S%H4908><s%> according <S%H5921><s%> to the command <S%H6310><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> they remained <S%H2583><s%> camped. <S%H2583><s%> Then according <S%H5921><s%> to the command <S%H6310><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> they set <S%H5265><s%> out.

If sometimes <S%H3426><s%> the cloud <S%H6051><s%> remained <S%H1961><s%> from evening <S%H6153><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> morning, <S%H1242><s%> when the cloud <S%H6051><s%> was lifted <S%H5927><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> they would move <S%H5265><s%> out; or <S%H176><s%> [if it remained] in the daytime <S%H3119><s%> and at night, <S%H3915><s%> whenever the cloud <S%H6051><s%> was lifted, <S%H5927><s%> they would set <S%H5265><s%> out.

Whether <S%H176><s%> it was two days <S%H3117><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a month <S%H2320><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a year <S%H3117><s%> that the cloud <S%H6051><s%> lingered <S%H748><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> the tabernacle, <S%H4908><s%> staying <S%H7931><s%> above <S%H5921><s%> it, the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> remained <S%H2583><s%> camped <S%H2583><s%> and did not set <S%H5265><s%> out; but when it was lifted, <S%H5927><s%> they did set <S%H5265><s%> out.

At the command <S%H6310><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> they camped, <S%H2583><s%> and at the command <S%H6310><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> they set <S%H5265><s%> out; they kept <S%H8104><s%> the Lord <S%H3068><s%>'s charge, <S%H4931><s%> according <S%H5921><s%> to the command <S%H6310><s%> of the Lord through <S%H3027><s%> Moses. <S%H4872><s%>
